==Events==
*[[19 AD]] &ndash; Roman general [[Germanicus]] suddenly dies in [[Antioch]] under mysterious circumstances. Roman historian [[Tactius]] records that Germanicus was poisoned by [[Roman Syria|Syrian]] Governor [[Gnaeus Calpurnius Piso]] under orders from [[Roman emperor]] [[Tiberius]].
* [[680]] &ndash; [[Battle of Karbala]]:  [[Hussain bin Ali]], the grandson of the Prophet [[Muhammad]], is [[decapitation|decapitated]] by forces under [[Caliph]] [[Yazid I]]. This is commemorated by [[Muslim]]s as [[Aashurah]].
* [[732]] &ndash; [[Battle of Tours]]: Near [[Poitiers]], [[France]], the leader of the [[Franks]], [[Charles Martel]] and his men, defeat a large army of [[Moors]], stopping the [[Muslim]]s from spreading into [[Western Europe]]. The governor of [[Córdoba, Spain|Cordoba]], [[Abdul Rahman Al Ghafiqi]], is killed during the battle.
*[[1471]] &ndash; [[Battle of Brunkeberg]] in [[Stockholm]]: [[Sten Sture the Elder]], the [[Regent]] of [[Sweden]], with the help of [[farmer]]s and [[miner]]s, repels an attack by [[Christian I of Denmark|Christian I]], [[King of Denmark]].
*[[1575]] &ndash; [[Battle of Dormans]]: [[Roman Catholic]] forces under Duke [[Henry of Guise]] defeat the [[Protestants]], capturing [[Philippe de Mornay]] among others.
*[[1580]] &ndash; Over 600 [[Papal States|Papal]] soldiers land  at [[Ard na Caithne|Dún an Óir]], [[Ireland]] to support a rebellion.
*[[1582]] &ndash; Because of the implementation of the [[Gregorian calendar#Gregorian reform|Gregorian calendar]] this day does not exist in this year in [[Italy]], [[Poland]], [[Portugal]] and [[Spain]].
*[[1631]] &ndash; An [[Electorate of Saxony]] army takes over [[Prague]].
*[[1760]] &ndash; In a treaty with the Dutch colonial authorities, the [[Ndyuka people]] of [[Suriname]] - descended from [[Maroon (people)|escaped slaves]] - gain territorial autonomy. 
*[[1780]] &ndash; The [[Great Hurricane of 1780]] kills 20,000–30,000 in the [[Caribbean]].
*[[1845]] &ndash; In [[Annapolis, Maryland]], the Naval School (later renamed the [[United States Naval Academy]]) opens with 50 midshipman students and seven professors.
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[Triton (moon)|Triton]], the largest moon of the planet [[Neptune]], is discovered by English astronomer [[William Lassell]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; The original [[cornerstone]] of the [[University of the South]] is laid in [[Sewanee, Tennessee|Sewanee]], [[Tennessee]].
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Carlos Céspedes]] issues the [[Grito de Yara]] from his [[plantation]], La Demajagua, proclaiming [[Cuba]]'s independence
*[[1871]] &ndash; [[The Great Chicago Fire]]: Chicago burns after a barn accident. The fire lasts from October 8 to October 10.
*[[1897]] &ndash; German chemist [[Felix Hoffmann]] [[History of aspirin|discovers]] an improved way of synthesizing [[aspirin|acetylsalicylic acid]] (aspirin).
*[[1910]] &ndash; [[Tau Epsilon Phi]]: Tau Epsilon Phi Fraternity is founded on the campus of [[Columbia University]] in [[New York City]], [[New York]].
*[[1911]] &ndash; The [[Wuchang Uprising]] leads to the demise of [[Qing Dynasty]], the last Imperial court in [[China]], and the founding of the [[Republic of China (1912–1949)|Republic of China]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[President of the United States|President]] [[Woodrow Wilson]] triggers the explosion of the Gamboa Dike thus ending construction on the [[Panama Canal]].
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Carinthian Plebiscite]] determines that the larger part of [[Carinthia (duchy)|Carinthia]] should remain part of [[Austria]].
*[[1928]] &ndash; [[Chiang Kai-Shek]] becomes [[President of the Republic of China|Chairman of the Republic of China]].
*[[1933]] &ndash; [[United Airlines Chesterton Crash]]: A [[United Airlines]] [[Boeing 247]] is destroyed by [[sabotage]], the first such proven case in the history of [[commercial aviation]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; A coup d'état by the royalist leadership of the Greek Armed Forces takes place in Athens. It overthrows the government of [[Panagis Tsaldaris]] and establishes a regency under [[Georgios Kondylis]], effectively ending the [[Second Hellenic Republic]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; The [[Munich Agreement]] cedes the [[Sudetenland]] to [[Nazi Germany]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union]] establishes [[diplomatic relations]] with [[Australia]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[Double Tenth Incident]] in Japanese-controlled [[Singapore]]
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]]: 800 [[Romani (people)|Gypsy]] children are murdered at [[Auschwitz concentration camp]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[Chinese Communist Party]] and the [[Kuomintang]] signed a principle agreement in [[Chongqing]] about the future of post-war China.  Later, the pact is commonly referred to as the [[Double-Ten Agreement]].
*[[1953]] &ndash; [[Mutual Defense Treaty Between the United States and the Republic of Korea]] is concluded in [[Washington D.C.]]
*[[1957]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] apologizes to the [[finance minister]] of [[Ghana]], [[Komla Agbeli Gbdemah]], after he is refused service in a [[Dover, Delaware]] restaurant.
*  1957   &ndash; The [[Windscale fire]] in [[Cumbria]], [[United Kingdom|U.K.]] is the world's first major nuclear accident.
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[France]] cedes control of the [[Bizerte]] naval base to [[Tunisia]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; The opening ceremony of the [[1964 Summer Olympics]] in [[Tokyo]], [[Japan]], is broadcast live in the first Olympic telecast relayed by geostationary communication satellite.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Outer Space Treaty]], signed on [[January 27]] by more than sixty nations, comes into force.
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Fiji]] becomes independent.
*  1970   &ndash; In [[Montreal, Quebec]], a national crisis hits [[Canada]] when [[Quebec]] Vice-Premier and Minister of Labour [[Pierre Laporte]] becomes the second statesman kidnapped by members of the [[FLQ]] terrorist group.
*[[1971]] &ndash; Sold, dismantled and moved to the [[United States]], [[London Bridge (Lake Havasu City)|London Bridge]] reopens in [[Lake Havasu City, Arizona]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Vice President of the United States]] [[Spiro Agnew]] resigns after being charged with federal [[income tax]] evasion.
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Papua New Guinea]] joins the [[United Nations]].
*[[1980]] &ndash; A magnitude 7.3 [[1980 El Asnam earthquake|earthquake]] occurs in the [[Algeria]]n town of [[Chlef|El Asnam]]. 3,500 die and 300,000 are left homeless.
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[FMLN]] was founded in [[El Salvador]]. 
*[[1985]] &ndash; [[United States Navy]] [[Grumman F-14 Tomcat|F-14]] fighter jets intercept an [[Egypt]]ian plane carrying the [[wiktionary:Hijacking|hijackers]] of the ''[[MS Achille Lauro|Achille Lauro]]'' cruise ship, and force it to land at a [[NATO]] base in [[Sigonella]], [[Sicily]] where they are arrested.
*[[1986]] &ndash; An [[earthquake]] measuring 7.5 on the [[Richter Scale]] strikes [[San Salvador]], [[El Salvador]], killing an estimated 1,500 people.
*[[1997]] &ndash; An [[Austral Líneas Aéreas|Austral Airlines]] [[McDonnell Douglas DC-9|DC-9-32]] crashes and explodes near Nuevo Berlin, [[Uruguay]], killing 74.
*[[1998]] &ndash; A [[Lignes Aériennes Congolaises]] [[Boeing 727]] is [[1998 Lignes Aériennes Congolaises crash|shot down]] by rebels in Kindu, [[Democratic Republic of the Congo]], killing 41 people.
*[[2008]] &ndash; The [[10 October 2008 Orakzai bombing]] kills 110 and injures 200 more.
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[Armenia]] and [[Turkey]] sign protocols in Zurich, Switzerland to open their borders.
*[[2010]] &ndash; The [[Netherlands Antilles]] are dissolved as a country.
